reviews.text: Love their events for kids! We've done Christmas twice and the Halloween pumpkin hunt. Nice way to introduce my preschooler to history while having fun.
Lots of layered history there. Way more than the Lees. One of the last owners basically started the AFL-CIO. Very knowledgeable guide. I believe her name was Jill. She was great!
Great story...only downfall is that the whole house wasn't shown to us.

Lovely historic architecture here in a distinctly Federal style common in the region, worth a drive by or a visit if you appreciate this sort of thing. The city of Alexandria itself has been overrun with something Federal, although of a completely different definition than "Federal architecture" - the DC yuppie, participating in my nation's sort of postmodern corporate industrial complex for big salaries and egos. Parking is difficult to find. Overall, as a "damn Yankee" I enjoyed my stop here.
Looks good from the outside
A great visit for sightseeing. We stopped here as part of a larger tour group to Mt Vernon. Our guide in the church was very knowledgeable and it was an interesting place to stop.
The cemetery looks like a quaint place to chat.  The gift shop is cozy.  The building is beautiful.  And the hostorical markers and good ole' George Washington membership reference.
I like this place!!!! I really feel very peace here. Positive vibes, Historical building, neat and clean place
Famous old church. Interesting cemetery

Absolutely Beautiful Church right in Old Town. Lots of history plus amazing grounds (with a cemetary on the property). A must see for anyone visiting! Also a wonderful place for Fellowship (refer to the Where and When for meeting types and times). All are welcome!!

This is a great museum to appreciate early American history in Alexandria.  The house has been restored to near perfect replica of its heyday.  The staff are really friendly,  welcoming and very knowledgeable of the history of the home as well as Alexandria as a whole.  We will definitely be back to learn more (you need more than an hour tour to really take the history in).  Thanks!

Very cool place to visit! The bf and I happened to be walking by during a free event. There were live demonstrations,  volunteers in every room (including outside) to answer questions,  and actors in period costume. I would relate this visit to visiting Mt. Vernon but on a smaller scale and probably a little cheaper (I think you have to pay to visit). I would definitely visit again and ask for a private tour as there was a lot going on that day to all the questions I wanted to.
Another Historical gem in Alexandria. Beautifully kept grounds. The tour is well worth your time, blending local history of Alexandria with greater American history.
Great southern-inspired food; loved the fried chicken. Surprisingly spacious inside. Hannah was a helpful waitress!
Great history here. Learned some things i did not know. Worth the $15 tour.

I did a quick tour at this mini pharmacy museum a few hours before my flight and I'm glad I did that. The tour is quick and affordable and I didn't have to wait long since they start a tour every after 30 minutes. Our guide is very knowledgeable and we are welcome to ask any questions we like. I enjoyed my trip here and amazed how they were able to maintain such a unique museum.

Very cool place! Disappointed in the guide - she wasn’t friendly or welcoming. At one point I wanted a picture of something without other people in it and so I patiently waited for people to leave the room. As I went to take the photo (which takes seconds) she impolitely informed me that the tour was over and there would be no more pictures. It was worth the $5, hopefully you get a nicer guide!
Great place to take a tour. The guides are friendly and quite knowledgeable. Also great for Harry Potter fans. Take the kids with you.

A unique and relatively unknown destination to check out! Apperantly Martha Washington would buy medicine here. When I last went I took my boyfriend and no one else was there so we were given a private tour! Very informative guide and a cool and unusual bit of history!

Must see, predecessor of a modern pharmacy. Staff is very helpful and knowledgeable, they are all volunteers, so please donate for this wonderful place to keep it open & running.
Also don’t forget to check out Martha Washington’s big order of laxatives!!

What a find!
I was in Alexandria for a conference and wanted an easy run in a safe place. Well, I also got some history with this as well. It is a great loop for walking and running with the history of the fort during civil war times. There are bathrooms and parking, an ampitheatre, playground and benches so there is something for everyone. Very pretty in the Spring.

This is historic site and also a park, the headquarters building is a small museum. There are artifacts and interesting stories about the forts located around the DC area. This is the best preserved civil war era fort in the DC area. They have rebuilt one of the bastian's to the original specifications and armed it with period replica cannons. Admission and parking are free.

Nice little Fort, one of the many built around the Capital to protect it during the American Civil War, and great place to visit in good weather.  Visited it with my Mom and the staff was friendly and the museum, while small, had a lot of artifacts.  The park is open to the public.  I had a friend who liked to walk it during the weekends because he lived so close to it.

The museum is very nicely done if kind of small. The exhibits are well explained by the signage. The walking trails are fine over the paved portions but where they are not paved, they are mud holes.  For some reason the signs seem to direct you to the worst of the mud.  The maps at the various stops do a good job of explaining what you are looking at.

This little museum and park is worth a visit! It had some interesting displays that made the soldiers in the civil war very real. The docents are friendly ascended willing to share. The mounds and cannons are interesting. A beautiful park, and it also has cookout sites and a nice playground.

I haven't been to Bilbo Baggins in over a decade, but when I lived in Arlington, it was legendary for the fresh-baked bread and hard to get into. I was pleased, therefore, to get a reservation on a Thursday night. I gushed over it to my daughter on the way over. When we arrived, the upstairs dining room (formerly packed on any given day) was closed, and only half the tables were in use downstairs. There was no offer of bread, and our waiter was long in seating, providing menus, and just about everything else. The beer list was still up to snuff, as was the food, but my happy memories were crushed, and I shan't be back.

The food was excellent. I think they were very short staffed, as it appeared a bartender and single server we're the only front staff, but the server did a good job considering he was solo. The food was very good, and nice selection of beers
Excellent food. Wonderful atmosphere.  Friendly service. Never had a bad experience there. Definitely a must visit if you are a fan of The Hobbit.

My family and I had a great experience dining at Bilbo Baggins for lunch.  We were able to talk to one of the owners and learn the history of the location, which has now been in operation 39 years.  The food was good, beer selection is great and the ambience and conversation were fantastic.  We would definitely come back.  Thanks!  :-)
This is a great place to be at if you’re a fan of the hobbit. They look to have great happy hour deals. I really want to come back.

I learned a lot of history from this Museum. The posters and signs are very informative, with a detailed history of great people having lunch, slept and sung at this tavern, like Hamilton, George Washington and Thomas Jefferson. It's also great to know that this place used to celebrate parties and big events from the past. The people here did a great job maintaining everything at this tavern. I highly recommend every tourist to visit this place.

Meant for Gadsbys Tavern restaurant: 

If you want delicious food and drink with some colonial charm this is the place! I had the lemon chicken with rice. The food was excellent with the right amount of spice. The servers and staff are in period costume. The height of the meal - a toast by one of the colony's great unknown orators, Master Hall, a gentleman farmer who surprised and engaged us all with his wit, humor and charm. Cheers to you, sir! I dont know when I'll be in the area again, but very much look forward to my next visit to Gadsby's!
A very nice and knowledgeable volunteer. I would like to see more period decor. It's a little scant.

Visited on free Museum Weekend, certain museums offer no fee admission, took the guided tour which covered all interior levels. You can take the tour on your own as well. After the guided tour you can go back on your own for more in depth research if you desire.

I would like to point out first off that I didn’t eat inside this tavern I’m leaving this because I took a walking tour with a classroom and as part of the tour we stopped outside this tavern for the spooky story. The story that our guide told paled in comparison to the fall risk potential of leaving this restaurant in the dark . I helped along with my friend and elderly couple exiting the building after their meal and was terrified they were going to trip and break a bone.  I did see on this stair way it says “handicap entrance” with an arrow . What this sign doesn’t help is that older people don’t always look up and see that , they were focused on each little step and never paid attention . They were also on a large tour bus that prevented them from parking and entering the other entrance. Two more groups exited while I watched and prayed no one else fell out.

So, yesterday, after enjoying our Free Ice Cream Cone at Ben & Jerry's, me and my friends headed over to the Hard Times Cafe for dinner.  Now, we had eaten there before, a long time ago, and we were looking forward to our meal.  First off, the staff was friendly and welcoming.  The waiter asked, right off the bat, if we wanted separate checks - which was nice because we did.  The cafe wasn't too busy, it was a little after 7 PM, so there was no waiting.
I had the 5-way Chili Mac with Veggie Chili and a Diet Coke.  They started us out with corn bread after serving us our drinks and our food was served pretty quickly and was tasty.  Afterwards, even though I shouldn't have, I ordered a Reese's Peanut Butter Pie.  To be honest I was full but the dessert menu looked so good!  And the pie was perfect - with whipped cream and some chocolate syrup. 
Overall the price wasn't that bad either, even including the tip.  I have to say the Hard Times Cafe is one of those places where you CAN visit it a few times a season without worrying about your wallet and just enjoy the food.  Also, it is far enough away from the Waterfront NOT to be too crowded or filled with tourists.  But it also means it is close to the King Street Station when you need to get back home via one of the buses or the subway.  As we all had to get home via public transport it was nice that we were served so quickly and were so close to the station.  Yet, we never felt rushed!  I wish I could give them more stars - I have been to a few Hard Times Cafe and have NEVER been disappointed.

This is a pretty simple little place. It's a chain, or it used to be. Most or all of the other locations have closed. They serve Tex-Mex bar food, mainly chili. They have four kinds of chili, including vegetarian. They also serve Shiner Bock beer from Texas. The servers are all very nice and helpful. Good for a quick bite or a relaxing beer. The chili, cheese and spaghetti 3-way is filling, but could do with a little less spaghetti and more chili and cheese.

Great flavors of chili. Texas, Cincinnati, red Texas, and vegetarian. We loved them all. The homemade cornbread was delicious. The only thing I would have liked better were the beans to be cooked longer. They were too hard when biting into them. I had the five-way chili. Absolute delicacy!

I understand that it has been around for quite some time but the place just feels dark and dirty and not in a cool dive bar kind of way.  Had their chili (Texas style not their signature one) it was ok.  Not unhappy but not excited about going back either
This place has truly awesome chili choices! They also serve a bowl of water tots with chili, cheese, and sour cream... Oh my gosh, so good!

I can’t say enough good things about the friendly and accommodating staff at this restaurant.  We took our grandchildren out to dinner while their parents dined with congressional representatives.  The kids had quirky food choices – plain pasta with no butter or cream sauce, plain cheese, carrot sticks, etc.  Everything was served as requested with smiles and pleasant grace.  The food was delicious.  We will definitely go back tomorrow night!

Some of the food is good. But be sure to pray over it! The kitchen staff use gloves sometimes, when they're in a good mood I guess. There are rat traps all over the place. The place needs a good scrubbing with Clorox. The owner is really rude & nasty when things don't go her way. It is good for groups, but the servers don't make any money off of the groups.... but the restaurant does. The bartenders make bomb drinks and there's music on the weekend.
One of my favorite joints in Alexandria.  The live music here is outstanding.  The food platters are remarkable and great flavor.

I went to the King Street Blues with a party of 100 when I visited Washington DC, and I disliked it. There were numerous problems during my recent experience.

Food: The chicken salad was very small. There were only five pieces of chicken. Their homemade chips were very poor quality. They were not crispy. The texture resembled cardboard. It was oily and not seasoned at all. It was cold. The fried chicken was even worse. It had very little chicken meat and was mostly breading. It was extremely bland and lacked seasoning. This was also cold, as if they had left it in the kitchen and forgot to serve it to us. Lastly, the fries were cold, oily, and soggy. The texture of the fries were bad. They contained very little potato inside.

Restaurant: The bathrooms were not clearly labeled; only with two random pictures. Inside the bathroom, it was small and dim. It clearly needs to be cleaned and renovated. The decor and atmosphere was okay. We had to go up two sets of stairs in order to sit down.

Had a fantastic dinner with my wife and son, everything made fresh on the premises and amazingly full of flavor. And our server, Olivia, just topped the entire visit with her humor and attention to detail.  A must on our next trip!

I'm not really sure why people are saying this is not worth the price because this is one of the best meals I've had. We did the tasting menu (5 courses is going to be more than enough) and ordered a bottle of wine. They started us with three primies before the five course menu. Everything was absolutely delicious. This is fine dining so it is going to be more that the normal place, but I think this is worth every single dollar!

This place has always been amazing and the food is delicious. You always have options as to what you want to get if you don't want the tasting menu which is great. When you are celebrating something, they always send a little something like a piece of chocolate saying "Happy Birthday", makes it very personal.

I've had lunch here a few times and have always enjoyed the food and creative presentation. The place can sometimes give off a nouveau air, but I enjoy going there nevertheless. They bake very good bread, and they have a delicious grilled peach dessert that I've gotten every time.

One of the best restaurants in the area, hands down. If this restaurant was eligible to receive a michelin star, I have no doubts that it would. Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and a talented chef.

EDIT: the chef is pursuing some other ventures, and is sadly closing down this place. Look for Chef Cathal Armstrong's restaurants, they recently posted that a new location might be built into Restaurant Eve 2.
Service is awesome here and the dining space itself is very charming. But the food was so salty. Did a tasting menu and absolutely everything was too salty, except from the dessert.
Best place to get beers in town! Always something new on tap.
Great selection of bear, nice atmosphere. Only problem is that it gets a bit crowded.
Love this place. Best beer in town by a wide margin.
Plenty of beers on draught. ! Cozy athosphere
Nice place, but beers are uneven.

Been there for lunch and dinner buffets. Great selection of food. Not the best sushi, but better than you'd expect for a buffet. All the raw bar selections are of great quality. Unfortunately, I've never left thinking that I had enough self control to stop before getting overstuffed. I keep going back, though.
Excellent services. Great food. Authentic korean food at a reasonable price. Family/kids friendly. I'm glad I found this restaurant.

A great buffet with the added bonus that they cook the meats at your table like a regular Korean BBQ place does, but it's all you can eat. They have sushi and other options as well, including salad, a build your own lettuce wrap station and even a few Chinese dishes.  Sakai and beer as well. Week point us the desert bar. All the selection and decent quality comes with a hefty price tag tho.

Very good for quality, quick and excellent service.  Only real complaints were the language barrier (our hostess/cook spoke very little English), but this was only a minor problem, as little patience got us through.  Open very late on the weekends, too!
Food was good !! The waiter was awesome!! But manager was a real jerk. Doesnt understand customer service at all !!

Best Chinese restaurant in Northern Virginia. My wife and I have tried them all and this is consistently the best. It’s also one of the nicest as far as staff, decor, ambience, etc. if you’re dining in, although they do a lot of carry out business also. Peking duck is second to none. We’ve been coming here over 20 years and most of the staff has been there longer than that.

We used to go here regularly, years ago (decades ago, in fact), and it was one of our favourites.  This evening, it was still every bit as good as I remembered.  The service is prompt, attentive, and friendly.  The place is clean, but intimate and cozy.  And - the food remains the best overall Chinese food in the area, in my opinion.  It is pricy, but I never feel cheated here when it comes time to pay.
Very delicious!  I did carryout & it was fast.  It's a popular place so there were 8-10 people ahead of me.  I got sesame shrimp & vegetable lo mein - YUM.

Service is excellent; the staff is very attentive, even on a busy Saturday evening. The food is delicious and the portions are large enough that we brought home leftovers for dinner the next day. Highly recommend House of Dynasty!

This has been our family's favorite restaurant for years. We always bring our family/friends here when they come to town or when we're celebrating for special occasions. It's a little pricey, but worth every penny. It has fantastic service and a great atmosphere. If you decide to do take-out instead (which is an option), you'll never be able to eat take-out from anywhere else -- the food is phenomenal. Family favorites include the Orange Chicken, Cashew Shrimp, Cashew Chicken, and the Wonton Soup.

Extremely poor. Very dated and tired restaurant. Bread came out and was stale.. hard as a rock. Food was greasy and just overall not appealing. Service was equally poor.. had to ask five people for the check, had multiple people ask for our order.. the restaurant wasn’t busy and somehow they managed to make things extremely complicated. Very very disappointed with the horrible food and poor service. Won’t be back

Paradiso is our family's go to place. We like their Sunday brunch and we have enjoyed their musical acts over many years. Their pizza is wood fired and delicious. Good consistent service and the food quality is very good.
The staff was considerate. Wide choice of menu items. Food was so fresh and came out fast! Full of flavor.
Had our school's annual staff appreciation dinner here. Great food and great service! Will return...
Nice place. Kid friendly space with the adjoining adult room. Good reliable place for Italian comfort food.
This place is just plain fun.  Great crab cakes, need to add an interesting sauce.  Presentation was good - kids loved the place too.
Very caribbean look and feel to this restaurant. The menu is very seafood heavy so if you're allergic, it may limit your choices significantly. There's also a pretty good brunch on Sundays.
Not impressed. Taken over at night by thugs into a pseudo Dane club full of trashy people.

Parking was a bit*h. 
Great food and service. Love the wings!

I really did not like the food. I ordered the Crispy Fried “Diego” Style Shrimp and hated it. The batter was too salty and  “Bam” sauce was just bad.

The decor was very tropical matching the theme of the restaurant and service was excellent

We chose delivery so this is based on delivery and pizza only. Delivery ordering was super easy and the pizza arrived very quickly. Pizza was hot and pretty good. Not the best I've ever had but definitely going into the rotation.

Completely underestimated this pizza place. Mike the manager provides excellent customer service if your not satisfied with your order. The pizza is phenomenal and sometimes it may take an extra 10 minutes because they are making the pie by hand. Yum

The pizza here is amazing, I just want to complaint about the store closing 10mns early than what's stated on the door. I came at 8:50pm and it's closed why???
I was gonna order to go anyways. Staff should follow door sign hours or change your open hours. I never write any reviews and I'm just upset bc I was really hungry.
The gluten free Mexican: Best. Pizza. Ever. Especially for a person who cannot have the real deal. The organic ingredients are a major bonus! Friendly staff and clean.

Their pizza is consistently good. The only problem I've had with them is their delivery times. My recommendation would be to make sure you order WELL in advance of when you want your pizza, or to even go pick it up yourself. Overall, great pizza (above average) and great service.
